messages: ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:42): IE's mode setting thing doesn't interact well with the Live DOM Viewer
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:47): Hmm, the <svg xmlns=foo> things the second time you use it on a page
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:47): s/things/thing works/
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:49): ...but when I say "works", I mean that in basically the opposite sense to usual, because it breaks the parsing of everything after the second usage
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:51): i really am very disappointed in their insistence on continuing this xmlns= crap in text/html
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:51): the more they do with this, the more screwed we are in html5 in terms of adding namespaces
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:51): though maybe we can just do ns= or something
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:59): The more annoying thing is how simply using colons (with no xmlns or anything) causes occasional XML-like parsing
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:00): well that's ok
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:00): don't use colons :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:00): we've already learnt (the hard way) that prefixes are a horrible idea
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:00): so whatever we do end up doing won't have prefixes

f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (02:04): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, could you please document how you've learned that prefixes are a horrible idea so others won't keep repeating and reproposing that mistake?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:05): yeah i have a half-written blog post on the subject
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:05): i add to it occasionally
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:05): one day it'll even get finished :-)
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (02:06): And then someone will point out how all the problems are really just awesome features that we aren't ready to leverage yet
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:06): yup
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:06): but we don't have to agree with them
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (02:07): I'm just wondering if there are any people left who don't either know or don't want to know :)

8c8837db54a2907cacd8633547977e33 (02:21): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: regarding <http://lists.whatwg.org/pipermail/whatwg-whatwg.org/2008-March/014156.html>, the paragraph starting "Fourth", was my understanding of how data: URIs work according to the spec wrong?  the code to create the window at a data: location is <http://bonsai.mozilla.org/cvsblame.cgi?file=/mozilla/dom/tests/mochitest/whatwg/test_postMessage_special.xhtml&rev=1.2&mark=266-283#265>...
8c8837db54a2907cacd8633547977e33 (02:21): ...-- should events posted from that window have .origin be that of the test_postMessage_special.xhtml page?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:30): 8c8837db54a2907cacd8633547977e33: i expect the spec to change regarding the origin of data: URIs
8c8837db54a2907cacd8633547977e33 (02:32): I shall forget I ever had concerns about that part, for now :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:35): wait, the spec already seems to be updated
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:35): i'm confused
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:35): the spec says:
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:35): "The origin of a Document or image that was generated from a data: URI found in another Document or in a script is the origin of the Document or script.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:36): "
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:36): what is it firefox does?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:39): 8c8837db54a2907cacd8633547977e33: ^ (in case you're not watching teh channel :-) )

8c8837db54a2907cacd8633547977e33 (02:40): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I could have sworn last I looked that data: URIs each had a globally unique identifier as their origin; it's possible you changed it since I last looked
8c8837db54a2907cacd8633547977e33 (02:41): (and I tend to watch sporadically or flip here when I get pinged :-) )
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:41): the spec says:
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:41): The origin of a Document or image that was generated from a data: URI found in another Document or in a script is the origin of the Document or script.

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:41): The origin of a Document or image that was generated from a data: URI from another source is a globally unique identifier assigned when the document is created.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:41): is that what you want it to say?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:41): or do you want it to say something else?
8c8837db54a2907cacd8633547977e33 (02:42): I think that's what Firefox does, which is most convenient for me (I don't have a particular desire one way or another except to avoid work on my part) :-)
8c8837db54a2907cacd8633547977e33 (02:42): I'm guessing the "other source" is, e.g., stuff typed in the location bar
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:43): yeah
8c8837db54a2907cacd8633547977e33 (02:44): might be worth mentioning that as an example of the latter, fwiw
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:47): send mail
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:47): no wait
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:47): i have it right here
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:47): i can just do that
